linesOfText.text:
Once there was a boy named Luke who did not like to brush his
teeth, not in the morning, not at night.
His teeth were yellow because he would not brush them.

Before bed-time Luke's mother
said to him, "Luke it's time to
brush your teeth."

"But I don't want to," was
Luke's reply.

"But you ate so much candy. The
sugar bugs will eat your teeth!
Luke, it's very important for
you to brush your teeth! If
you don't brush them,
you'll have food stuck
in-between them, you'll
have bad breath and the
other children are not going
to want to play with you.
"But I don't want to,"
Luke insisted,
digging
in his heels.

And once again he went to bed without brushing his teeth.
When Luke was asleep... he started to dream...

He dreamed that his teeth
decided to leave his mouth and search
for a new mouth. A mouth that really needed them
and would take care of them properly.

Luke's teeth were tired of being
dirty and smelly. They were afraid to be
eaten by the sugar bugs!

They knew what happens to teeth that stay dirty for a long time.
In Luke's dream, his teeth began searching for a new mouth in which to live.
They found Emily, Luke's baby sister who had no teeth at all.

To her they cried:
"We are Luke's teeth,
and we want to be clean.
Shiny and white,
well not with food stuck in-between.

When Luke is asked to brush his teeth,
he makes such a fuss.
But we don't want
the nasty sugar bugs to eat us!
Can we live in your mouth?"

Emily nodded her head, opened wide and the teeth hopped into her mouth.
But they couldn't all fit.

So Emily said to them:
"I would love to have some teeth,
but my mouth is too small.
I can't brush my teeth yet,
For I haven't any at all.
I think you need a different mouth."

So Luke's teeth kept searching and
they met Ben the turtle.

To Ben, Luke's teeth cried:
"We are Luke's teeth,
and we want to be clean.
Shiny and white,
well not with food stuck in-between.

When Luke is asked to Brush his teeth,
he makes such a fuss.
But we don't want
the nasty sugar bugs to eat us!
Can we live in your mouth?"

Ben nodded his head and the teeth hopped
into his mouth.
He then tried to chew some weeds but
they got stuck in his new teeth.

So Ben the turtle said:
"I would love to have some teeth,
but I eat vegetables and weeds.
This beak at the end of my mouth
is everything I need.
I think you need a different mouth."

Luke's teeth then said goodbye to
Ben and went on searching.

Next, they met Zoe the bird.

To Zoe, Luke's teeth cried:
"We are Luke's teeth,
and we want to be clean.
Shiny and white,
not with food stick in-between.
When Luke is asked to brush his teeth,
he makes such a fuss.
But we don't want
nasty sugar bugs to eat us!
Can we live in your mouth?"

Zoe put the teeth in her
tiny beak and flew up
to her nest.

But now she couldn't
feed her babies,
though she tried her best.

Zoe the bird said to Luke's teeth:
"Well I would love to have some teeth,
but I eat with my beak...
If I had Luke's teeth in my mouth,
I couldn't eat or speak.
I think you need a different mouth."

So Luke's teeth said goodbye to Zoe
and kept searching for the perfect mouth.
They next met Nelly the jellyfish.

To her they cried:
"We are Luke's teeth,
and we want to be clean.
Shiny and white,
not with food stuck in-between.
When Luke is asked to brush his teeth,
he makes such a fuss.
But we don't want
nasty sugar bugs to eat us!
Can we live in your mouth?"

Nelly put the teeth on the ends of her
tentacles but she started to sink.

She said:
"I would love to have some teeth,
but I am not so strong.
I'm made mostly of water,
I couldn't carry you long.
I think you need a different mouth."

Luke's teeth did not
know what to do.
They felt lost and
sad. They had searched
and searched and
still couldn't find a
nice mouth in which
to live.

They did not want to go back to
Luke's mouth. They were afraid
the sugar bugs would eat them
alive.

Then another idea flashed
in their mind... Bernie!
Bernie was Luke's elderly
neighbor, who didn't
know how important it
was to brush his teeth
when he was a child.
He now only had
FIVE teeth left!

But Bernie brushed his five teeth all the
time, and Luke's teeth decided that
Bernie's would be a fine mouth to
live in.

To Bernie they cried:
"We are Luke's teeth,
and we want to be clean.
Shiny and white,
not with food stuck in-between.
When Luke is asked to brush his teeth,
he makes such a fuss.
But we don't want
nasty sugar bugs to eat us!
Can we live in your mouth?"
"I would love to have more teeth!"
said Bernie, "Please jump right inside.
I will brush you every day." And he
opened his mouth wide...
Luke woke up in a panic, cold sweat on his face...
"Oh, my teeth! I hope it's not too late..."

He ran to the sink and grabbed his
toothbrush and toothpaste and brushed
his teeth thoroughly...

After brushing his teeth Luke returned
to his bed and fell asleep
again. He returned to his
dream and saw that his
teeth decided to give
him another chance.
His teeth stayed in
Luke's mouth.

From that night on, Luke was careful to brush his
teeth at least twice everyday. If you ever meet them,
you will see how they shine with happiness because
they are so clean.
THE END!
